description: Frustrated with other Bridge notation formats, Richard Pavlicek created the Richard's Bridge Notation, or RBN, format. According to Pavlicek, the RBN format fixes issues with both the Portable Bridge Notation ( .PBN ) and Bridge Base ( .LIN ) formats. Most notably, RBN files order information about a Bridge deal "more logically" and can contain information about many deals.
In an RBN file, each deal's description consists of 16 lines of information, labeled and ordered as follows:
RBN files can also include comments and other text, enclosed within { } . For example, after an RBN file's N line, it might include a description of the players involved, enclosed in { } .
